definition: to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
to fall/to degenerate
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: She degraded herself by cheating and telling lies.
He is a man who would stoop to anything .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个自甘堕落，什么事都干的家伙。

sentences.english: Clara might have stooped to listen at the door .
sentences.chinese: 克莱拉很可能自甘堕落，躲在门口偷听过。

sentences.english: He alone sinks to the rear and the slaves!
sentences.chinese: 他自甘堕落成俯首贴耳的奴隶。

sentences.english: The road to positivity is strewn with the abandoned vehicles of the faint-hearted.
sentences.chinese: 通往乐观的道路上布满了胆怯和自甘堕落的车辆。

sentences.english: Have too many helpless, is still self-abandonment , thoroughly the heart die.
sentences.chinese: 有太多的无奈，还是自甘堕落，彻底心死吧。

sentences.english: I will be sad, but it will not remain to corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 我会难过，但是不会自甘堕落。

sentences.english: And man hath bowed himself down, and man hath been debased: therefore forgive them not.
sentences.chinese: 如此，人自甘卑下，自甘堕落，对他们决无救援。

definition: to degrade/to degenerate/to become depraved/corrupt/a fall from grace
to belittle oneself/self-contempt
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
humble/lowly/depraved/contemptible
to wallow in the mire with sb (idiom); to follow the bad example of others
(idiom) to blame the gods and accuse others
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
to be cynical/to be embittered
vice/immorality/moral turpitude
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
to spurn/to disdain
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
